definition: rice tub (from which cooked rice or other food is served)/(fig.) fathead/a good-for-nothing
bucket/(trash) can/barrel (of oil etc)/CL:個|个[ge4],隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: Grilled Sculpin now correctly grants Ranged Attack Power.
sentences.chinese: 烤肉飯桶現在正確的贈款遠程攻擊力。

sentences.english: Poor clever boy besides it is a big big eater, still be a big Lothario .
sentences.chinese: 瘦猴除了是個大飯桶，還是個大色狼。

sentences.english: In fact, he is good for nothing.
Everyone from frash to presidents loves these words.
sentences.chinese: 從飯桶到總統，所有人都喜歡這幾個詞。

sentences.english: I don't know why you are still knocking about with him who is good-for-nothing.
sentences.chinese: 我不知道你爲什麼還與他混在一起，他簡直是個飯桶。

sentences.english: Luo Cai check for nothing nearly found drawings, fortunately Fang Gui timely help.
sentences.chinese: 羅財檢查飯桶時險些發現設計圖，幸好方貴及時幫忙。

sentences.english: Everyone from trash to presidents loves these words.
sentences.chinese: 從飯桶到總統，所有的人都喜歡用這幾個單詞。

definition: lit. dressed up animal (idiom)/fig. immoral and despicable person
to have no sense of shame
to make trouble out of nothing
to talk about this and that (idiom); to ramble incoherently
to amuse oneself/to play with/to tease
to mend one's ways (idiom)/to turn over a new leaf
to invent crazy nonsense/to cook up (excuses)/to talk at random/wild babble
worse than a dog or pig/lower than low
smile spread across the face (idiom); beaming with pleasure/all smiles/joy written across one's face
